key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris visited Brown Sugar Bakery in Chicago on her way from California to Washington, D.C.
Harris ordered a slice of German chocolate cake, citing it as her favorite, and received trays of cupcakes for her return trip.
Brown Sugar Bakery, founded by Stephanie Hart in 2004, is celebrated for its southern-style desserts and has received notable acclaim.
The bakery's caramel cake is particularly renowned, with Hart having learned the caramel recipe from an elderly lady in Arkansas.
Hart expanded her business by purchasing the Cupid Candies factory with a $500,000 state grant.
Despite pandemic challenges, including temporary closures, the bakery has continued to receive strong community support.
The community's support was highlighted by a $10,000 grant from the Local Initiatives Support Corporation featured on 'Good Morning America'.
Customers have shown dedication by waiting in line outside the bakery, even in cold weather.
The bakery has gained popularity not only locally but also ships nationwide.
The Vice President's visit and choice of the bakery for dessert was described as a 'sweet call'.
